comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20110113 Iceweasel/3.5.16 (like Firefox/3.5.16)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20110113 Iceweasel/3.5.16 (like Firefox/3.5.16)

The print preview doesn't display all the content of the page.
Moreover, sometimes when printing, I don't have the same nb of pages in the output file as displayed in preview.



Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Open page http://www.tipitaka.org/stp-pali-eng-parallel
I also attached it.

Print preview it.
Select 100%, and "paysage"


Actual Results:  
For me it will not display the full content of the page. It stops before. Eg at page 17. If I print it, it may print only 6 pages, or sometimes 17.

Strangely enough, if I set "portrait" mode, the preview doesn't show all the pages (it displays it up to 21 only), but when I print it, everything is there.


Same issue in Windows with version 3.5.13

The issue doesn't seem to be the same as in #534182 as there is no "inline-block" element.

(I Have gentium font installed for better rendering of some glyphs)

> output file as displayed in preview.
> 
> 
> 
> Reproducible: Always
> 
> Steps to Reproduce:
> Open page http://www.tipitaka.org/stp-pali-eng-parallel
> I also attached it.
> 
> Print preview it.
> Select 100%, and "paysage"
> 
> 
> Actual Results:  
> For me it will not display the full content of the page. It stops before. Eg at
> page 17. If I print it, it may print only 6 pages, or sometimes 17.
> 
> Strangely enough, if I set "portrait" mode, the preview doesn't show all the
> pages (it displays it up to 21 only), but when I print it, everything is there.
> 
> 
> Same issue in Windows with version 3.5.13
> 
> The issue doesn't seem to be the same as in #534182 as there is no
> "inline-block" element.
> 
> (I Have gentium font installed for better rendering of some glyphs)

Dear reporter, 

"I Have gentium font installed for better rendering of some glyphs" I suggest trying this with a new profile 

http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/profiles 

or you can re-install your firefox, leaving this time the gentium font. 
Also make sure you haven't any custom themes or add-ons installed. 
If we can rule out these, we can start investigating further. For the moment this is a WFM

comments.raw_text:
Hello,

Ok, I totally uninstalled the gentium font from my system
Relaunche ffx with "-ProfileManager" and created a new profile.

I print preview the page, it display page up to 13.
If I print it (to a pdf), it prints all the pages (39)

now in the print preview, I change to "paysage" layout, display & printing is ok.

If I switch paper size to A4, with "paysage", previews displays up to 7 pages,
comments.text:
Hello,

Ok, I totally uninstalled the gentium font from my system
Relaunche ffx with "-ProfileManager" and created a new profile.

I print preview the page, it display page up to 13.
If I print it (to a pdf), it prints all the pages (39)

now in the print preview, I change to "paysage" layout, display & printing is ok.

If I switch paper size to A4, with "paysage", previews displays up to 7 pages,

comments.raw_text:
(continuation of comment 4) 

and prints only 12 (ie, not the complete document)

I stay in A4, but switch to "portait" layout, it displays 11 pages, and print output has only 1 page.

Now, i go back to US Letter, in paysage, display shows 43 pages (ie the whole document) but print output is only 15 pages (the progress bar of printing is updated ~15 times, as if the bar is updated for each printed page)

so the behaviour seems inconsistent but buggy, and not linked to the gentium font

hope this helps
comments.creator: fabstz-it@yahoo.fr
comments.author: fabstz-it@yahoo.fr
comments.text:
(continuation of comment 4) 

and prints only 12 (ie, not the complete document)

I stay in A4, but switch to "portait" layout, it displays 11 pages, and print output has only 1 page.

Now, i go back to US Letter, in paysage, display shows 43 pages (ie the whole document) but print output is only 15 pages (the progress bar of printing is updated ~15 times, as if the bar is updated for each printed page)

so the behaviour seems inconsistent but buggy, and not linked to the gentium font

hope this helps

comments.raw_text:
Hi,

Well, I never noticed that on other website. And usually I don't have so long documents.
I just made a test with 
http://tldp.org/HOWTO/HOWTO-INDEX/howtos.html

And all the document is displayed...

The issue is with both the URL I gave you (or the attached to that bug report), ie 
http://www.tipitaka.org/stp-pali-eng-parallel
http://www.tipitaka.fr/sutta/digha/dn22.html

comments.text:
Hi,

Well, I never noticed that on other website. And usually I don't have so long documents.
I just made a test with 
http://tldp.org/HOWTO/HOWTO-INDEX/howtos.html

And all the document is displayed...

The issue is with both the URL I gave you (or the attached to that bug report), ie 
http://www.tipitaka.org/stp-pali-eng-parallel
http://www.tipitaka.fr/sutta/digha/dn22.html

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110217 Firefox/4.0b12pre

Issue can be also reproducible on 3.6.13 but not on other browsers.

Updated STR:
1. Go to http://www.tipitaka.org/stp-pali-eng-parallel
2. CTRL+P
3. Select option Print to file as pdf and Press print button
4. Scroll website, look at the last line and compare it with last line from pdf file.
